cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 115 miles ESE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: continuing northwest across the central Gulf of Mexico and then bending west-northwest toward the north-western Gulf coast (Louisiana–upper Texas) early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana coast, near or just south of New Orleans

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for U.S. Gulf coast as of Advisory 8
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect for U.S. Gulf coast as of Advisory 8
weather_observation.impacted_coast: coastal Louisiana, Mississippi, and upper Texas expected to feel effects as Marco approaches
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–63 kt) have an 11 % cumulative chance of affecting the port, peaking late Monday into Tuesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Elevated water levels 2–4 ft possible along Lake Borgne and the Mississippi Delta if the track remains close to the current forecast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could produce 4–8 inches with locally higher totals, leading to flash-flood concerns in the New Orleans metro.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rain bands; temporary port-access restrictions due to rising tides and reduced visibility.
